   19: %%
   20: -module(memsup_SUITE).
   21: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   22: 
   23: %% Test server specific exports
   24: -export([all/0, suite/0]).
   25: -export([init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   26: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   27: 
   28: %% Test cases
   29: -export([api/1, alarm1/1, alarm2/1, process/1]).
   30: -export([config/1, timeout/1, unavailable/1, port/1]).
   31: -export([otp_5910/1, improved_system_memory_data/1]).
   32: 
   33: 
   34: -define(SYSTEM_MEMORY_DATA_TAGS,
   35:         [available_memory,
   36:          total_memory,
   37:          free_memory,
   38:          system_total_memory,
   39:          largest_free,
   40:          number_of_free,
   41:          free_swap,
   42:          total_swap,
   43:          cached_memory,
   44:          buffered_memory,
   45:          shared_memory]).
   46: 
   47: init_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   48:     ok = application:start(os_mon),
   49:     Config.
   50: 
   51: end_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   52:     ok = application:stop(os_mon),
   53:     Config.
   54: 
   55: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   56:     Config.
   57: 
   58: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   59:     ok.
   60: 
   61: suite() ->
   62:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   63:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   64: 
   65: all() -> 
   66:     All = case os:type() of
   67:               {unix, sunos} ->
   68:                   [api, alarm1, alarm2, process, config, timeout,
   69:                    unavailable, port];
   70:               {unix, linux} ->
   71:                   [api, alarm1, alarm2, process, timeout];
   72:               _OS -> [api, alarm1, alarm2, process]
   73:           end,
   74:     Bugs = [otp_5910],
   75:     All ++ Bugs ++ [improved_system_memory_data].
   76: 
   77: 
   78: %% Test of API functions
   79: api(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   80: 
   81:     %% get_memory_data()
   82:     RegMemData = memsup:get_memory_data(),
   83:     case RegMemData of
   84:         {TotMem, AllBytes, {Pid, PidBytes}} when is_integer(TotMem),
   85:                                                  is_integer(AllBytes),
   86:                                                  is_pid(Pid),
   87:                                                  is_integer(PidBytes) ->
   88:             ok;
   89:         {0, 0, _WorstPid} ->
   90:             ct:fail(first_data_collection_failed);
   91:         _ ->
   92:             ct:fail({bad_return, RegMemData})
   93:     end,
   94: 
   95:     %% get_system_memory_data()
   96:     ExtMemData = memsup:get_system_memory_data(),
   97:     Tags = ?SYSTEM_MEMORY_DATA_TAGS,
   98: 
   99:     true = lists:all(fun({Tag,Value}) when is_atom(Tag),
  100:                                            is_integer(Value) ->
  101:                              lists:member(Tag, Tags);
  102:                         (_) ->
  103:                              false
  104:                      end, ExtMemData),
  105: 
  106:     %% get_os_wordsize()
  107:     ok = case memsup:get_os_wordsize() of
  108:              32 ->
  109:                  32 = 8*erlang:system_info({wordsize,external}),
  110:                  ok;
  111:              64 ->
  112:                  % No reliable test here
  113:                  ok;
  114:              unsupported_os ->
  115:                  ok;
  116:              _ ->
  117:                  error
  118:          end,
  119: 
  120:     %% get_check_interval()
  121:     60000 = memsup:get_check_interval(),
  122: 
  123:     %% set_check_interval(Minutes)
  124:     ok = memsup:set_check_interval(2),
  125:     120000 = memsup:get_check_interval(),
  126:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} =
  127:     (catch memsup:set_check_interval(0.2)),
  128:     120000 = memsup:get_check_interval(),
  129:     ok = memsup:set_check_interval(1),
  130: 
  131:     %% get_procmem_high_watermark()
  132:     5 = memsup:get_procmem_high_watermark(),
  133: 
  134:     %% set_procmem_high_watermark()
  135:     ok = memsup:set_procmem_high_watermark(0.1),
  136:     10 = memsup:get_procmem_high_watermark(),
  137:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} =
  138:     (catch memsup:set_procmem_high_watermark(-0.1)),
  139:     10 = memsup:get_procmem_high_watermark(),
  140:     ok = memsup:set_procmem_high_watermark(0.05),
  141: 
  142:     %% get_sysmem_high_watermark()
  143:     80 = memsup:get_sysmem_high_watermark(),
  144: 
  145:     %% set_sysmem_high_watermark()
  146:     ok = memsup:set_sysmem_high_watermark(0.9),
  147:     90 = memsup:get_sysmem_high_watermark(),
  148:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} =
  149:     (catch memsup:set_sysmem_high_watermark(-0.9)),
  150:     90 = memsup:get_sysmem_high_watermark(),
  151:     ok = memsup:set_sysmem_high_watermark(0.8),
  152: 
  153:     %% get|set_helper_timeout
  154:     30 = memsup:get_helper_timeout(),
  155:     ok = memsup:set_helper_timeout(29),
  156:     29 = memsup:get_helper_timeout(),
  157:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch memsup:set_helper_timeout(31.0)),
  158:     29 = memsup:get_helper_timeout(),
  159:     ok.
  160: 
  161: %%----------------------------------------------------------------------
  162: %% NOTE: The test case is a bit weak as it will fail if the memory
  163: %% usage changes too much during its course.
  164: %%----------------------------------------------------------------------
  165: 
  166: %% Test alarms when memsup_system_only==false
  167: alarm1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  168: 
  169:     %% If system memory usage is too high, the testcase cannot
  170:     %% be run correctly
  171:     {Total, Alloc, {_Pid,_PidAlloc}} = memsup:get_memory_data(),
  172:     io:format("alarm1: Total: ~p, Alloc: ~p~n", [Total, Alloc]),
  173:     SysUsage = Alloc/Total,
  174:     if
  175:         SysUsage > 0.99 ->
  176:             {skip, sys_mem_too_high};
  177:         true ->
  178:             alarm1(Config, SysUsage)
  179:     end.
  180: 
  181: alarm1(_Config, SysUsage) ->
  182:     %% Set a long memory check interval, we will force memory checks
  183:     %% instead
  184:     ok = memsup:set_check_interval(60),
  185: 
  186:     %% Check thresholds
  187:     SysThreshold = (memsup:get_sysmem_high_watermark()/100),
  188:     ProcThreshold = (memsup:get_procmem_high_watermark()/100),
  189: 
  190:     %% Check if a system alarm already should be set or not
  191:     SysP = if
  192:                SysUsage>SysThreshold -> true;
  193:                SysUsage=<SysThreshold -> false
  194:            end,
  195: 
  196:     %% If system memory is higher than threshold, make sure the system
  197:     %% alarm is set. Otherwise, make sure it is not set
  198:     case alarm_set(system_memory_high_watermark) of
  199:         {true, []} when SysP ->
  200:             ok;
  201:         false when not SysP ->
  202:             ok;
  203:         _ ->
  204:             ct:fail({sys_alarm, SysUsage, SysThreshold})
  205:     end,
  206: 
  207:     %% Lower/raise the threshold to clear/set the alarm
  208:     NewSysThreshold = if
  209:                           SysP ->
  210:                               Value = 1.1*SysUsage,
  211:                               if
  212:                                   Value > 0.99 -> 0.99;
  213:                                   true -> Value
  214:                               end;
  215:                           not SysP -> 0.9*SysUsage
  216:                       end,
  217: 
  218:     ok = memsup:set_sysmem_high_watermark(NewSysThreshold),
  219: 
  220:     %% Initiate and wait for a new data collection
  221:     ok = force_collection(),
  222: 
  223:     %% Make sure the alarm is cleared/set
  224:     ct:sleep({seconds,5}),
  225:     case alarm_set(system_memory_high_watermark) of
  226:         {true, []} when not SysP ->
  227:             ok;
  228:         false when SysP ->
  229:             ok;
  230:         _ ->
  231:             ct:fail({sys_alarm, SysUsage, NewSysThreshold})
  232:     end,
  233: 
  234:     %% Reset the threshold to set/clear the alarm again
  235:     ok = memsup:set_sysmem_high_watermark(SysThreshold),
  236:     ok = force_collection(),
  237:     ct:sleep({seconds,1}),
  238:     case alarm_set(system_memory_high_watermark) of
  239:         {true, []} when SysP ->
  240:             ok;
  241:         false when not SysP ->
  242:             ok;
  243:         _ ->
  244:             ct:fail({sys_alarm, SysUsage, SysThreshold})
  245:     end,
  246: 
  247:     %% Check memory usage
  248:     {Total2, _, {WorstPid, PidAlloc}} = memsup:get_memory_data(),
  249: 
  250:     %% Check if a process alarm already should be set or not
  251:     PidUsage = PidAlloc/Total2,
  252:     ProcP = if
  253:                 PidUsage>ProcThreshold -> true;
  254:                 PidUsage=<ProcThreshold -> false
  255:             end,
  256: 
  257:     %% Make sure the process alarm is set/not set accordingly
  258:     case alarm_set(process_memory_high_watermark) of
  259:         {true, WorstPid} when ProcP ->
  260:             ok;
  261:         false when not ProcP ->
  262:             ok;
  263:         {true, BadPid1} when ProcP ->
  264:             ct:fail({proc_alarm, WorstPid, BadPid1});
  265:         _ ->
  266:             ct:fail({proc_alarm, PidUsage, ProcThreshold})
  267:     end,
  268: 
  269:     %% Lower/raise the threshold to clear/set the alarm
  270:     NewProcThreshold = if
  271:                            ProcP -> 1.1*PidUsage;
  272:                            not ProcP -> 0.9*PidUsage
  273:                        end,
  274:     ok = memsup:set_procmem_high_watermark(NewProcThreshold),
  275:     ok = force_collection(),
  276:     ct:sleep({seconds,1}),
  277:     case alarm_set(process_memory_high_watermark) of
  278:         {true, WorstPid} when not ProcP ->
  279:             ok;
  280:         false when ProcP ->
  281:             ok;
  282:         {true, BadPid2} when not ProcP ->
  283:             ct:fail({proc_alarm, WorstPid, BadPid2});
  284:         _ ->
  285:             ct:fail({proc_alarm, PidUsage, ProcThreshold})
  286:     end,
  287: 
  288:     %% Reset the threshold to clear/set the alarm
  289:     ok = memsup:set_procmem_high_watermark(ProcThreshold),
  290:     ok = force_collection(),
  291:     ct:sleep({seconds,1}),
  292:     case alarm_set(process_memory_high_watermark) of
  293:         {true, WorstPid} when ProcP ->
  294:             ok;
  295:         false when not ProcP ->
  296:             ok;
  297:         {true, BadPid3} when ProcP ->
  298:             ct:fail({proc_alarm, WorstPid, BadPid3});
  299:         _ ->
  300:             ct:fail({proc_alarm, PidUsage, ProcThreshold})
  301:     end,
  302: 
  303:     %% Reset memory check interval
  304:     ok = memsup:set_check_interval(1),
  305:     ok.
  306: 
  307: %% Test alarms when memsup_system_only==true
  308: alarm2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  309: 
  310:     %% If system memory usage is too high, the testcase cannot
  311:     %% be run correctly
  312:     {Total, Alloc, {_Pid,_PidAlloc}} = memsup:get_memory_data(),
  313:     SysUsage = Alloc/Total,
  314:     if
  315:         SysUsage>0.99 ->
  316:             {skip, sys_mem_too_high};
  317:         true ->
  318:             alarm2(Config, SysUsage)
  319:     end.
  320: 
  321: alarm2(_Config, _SysUsage) ->
  322: 
  323:     %% Change memsup_system_only and restart memsup
  324:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, memsup_system_only, true),
  325:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(os_mon_sup, memsup),
  326:     {ok, _Memsup1} = supervisor:restart_child(os_mon_sup, memsup),
  327: 
  328:     %% Set a long memory check interval, we will force memory checks
  329:     %% instead
  330:     ok = memsup:set_check_interval(60),
  331: 
  332:     %% Check data and thresholds
  333:     {Total, Alloc, undefined} = memsup:get_memory_data(),
  334:     SysThreshold = (memsup:get_sysmem_high_watermark()/100),
  335:     true = is_integer(memsup:get_procmem_high_watermark()),
  336: 
  337:     %% Check if a system alarm already should be set or not
  338:     SysUsage = Alloc/Total,
  339:     SysP = if
  340:                SysUsage>SysThreshold -> true;
  341:                SysUsage=<SysThreshold -> false
  342:            end,
  343: 
  344:     %% If system memory is higher than threshold, make sure the system
  345:     %% alarm is set. Otherwise, make sure it is not set
  346:     case alarm_set(system_memory_high_watermark) of
  347:         {true, []} when SysP ->
  348:             ok;
  349:         false when not SysP ->
  350:             ok;
  351:         _ ->
  352:             ct:fail({sys_alarm, SysUsage, SysThreshold})
  353:     end,
  354: 
  355:     %% Lower/raise the threshold to clear/set the alarm
  356:     NewSysThreshold = if
  357:                           SysP ->
  358:                               Value = 1.1*SysUsage,
  359:                               if
  360:                                   Value > 0.99 -> 0.99;
  361:                                   true -> Value
  362:                               end;
  363:                           not SysP -> 0.9*SysUsage
  364:                       end,
  365: 
  366:     ok = memsup:set_sysmem_high_watermark(NewSysThreshold),
  367: 
  368:     %% Initiate and wait for a new data collection
  369:     ok = force_collection(),
  370: 
  371:     %% Make sure the alarm is cleared/set
  372:     ct:sleep({seconds,1}),
  373:     case alarm_set(system_memory_high_watermark) of
  374:         {true, []} when not SysP ->
  375:             ok;
  376:         false when SysP ->
  377:             ok;
  378:         _ ->
  379:             ct:fail({sys_alarm, SysUsage, NewSysThreshold})
  380:     end,
  381: 
  382:     %% Reset the threshold to set/clear the alarm again
  383:     ok = memsup:set_sysmem_high_watermark(SysThreshold),
  384:     ok = force_collection(),
  385:     ct:sleep({seconds,1}),
  386:     case alarm_set(system_memory_high_watermark) of
  387:         {true, []} when SysP ->
  388:             ok;
  389:         false when not SysP ->
  390:             ok;
  391:         _ ->
  392:             ct:fail({sys_alarm, SysUsage, SysThreshold})
  393:     end,
  394: 
  395:     %% Reset memsup_system_only and restart memsup
  396:     %% (memory check interval is then automatically reset)
  397:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, memsup_system_only, false),
  398:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(os_mon_sup, memsup),
  399:     {ok, _Memsup2} = supervisor:restart_child(os_mon_sup, memsup),
  400: 
  401:     ok.
  402: 
  403: alarm_set(Alarm) ->
  404:     alarm_set(Alarm, alarm_handler:get_alarms()).
  405: alarm_set(Alarm, [{Alarm,Data}|_]) ->
  406:     {true,Data};
  407: alarm_set(Alarm, [_|T]) ->
  408:     alarm_set(Alarm, T);
  409: alarm_set(_Alarm, []) ->
  410:     false.
  411: 
  412: %% Make sure memsup discovers a process grown very large
  413: process(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  414: 
  415:     %% Set a long memory check interval, we will force memory checks
  416:     %% instead
  417:     ok = memsup:set_check_interval(60),
  418: 
  419:     %% Collect data
  420:     MemData = memsup:get_memory_data(),
  421:     io:format("process: memsup:get_memory_data() = ~p~n", [MemData]),
  422:     {_Total,_Free,{_,Bytes}} = MemData,
  423: 
  424:     %% Start a new process larger than Worst
  425:     WorsePid = spawn(fun() -> new_hog(Bytes) end),
  426:     ct:sleep({seconds,1}),
  427: 
  428:     %% Initiate and wait for a new data collection
  429:     ok = force_collection(),
  430: 
  431:     %% Check that get_memory_data() returns updated result
  432:     case memsup:get_memory_data() of
  433:         {_, _, {WorsePid, _MoreBytes}} ->
  434:             ok;
  435:         {_, _, BadWorst} ->
  436:             ct:fail({worst_pid, BadWorst})
  437:     end,
  438: 
  439:     %% Reset memory check interval
  440:     exit(WorsePid, done),
  441:     ok = memsup:set_check_interval(1),
  442:     ok.
  443: 
  444: new_hog(Bytes) ->
  445:     WordSize = erlang:system_info(wordsize),
  446:     N = (Bytes+200) div WordSize div 2,
  447:     List = lists:duplicate(N, a),
  448:     new_hog_1(List).
  449: 
  450: new_hog_1(List) ->
  451:     receive
  452:         _Any -> exit(List)
  453:     end.
  454: 
  455: %% Test configuration
  456: config(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  457: 
  458:     %% Change configuration parameters and make sure change is reflected
  459:     %% when memsup is restarted
  460:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, memory_check_interval, 2),
  461:     ok =
  462:     application:set_env(os_mon, system_memory_high_watermark, 0.9),
  463:     ok =
  464:     application:set_env(os_mon, process_memory_high_watermark, 0.1),
  465:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, memsup_helper_timeout, 35),
  466:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, memsup_system_only, true),
  467: 
  468:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(os_mon_sup, memsup),
  469:     {ok, _Child1} = supervisor:restart_child(os_mon_sup, memsup),
  470: 
  471:     120000 = memsup:get_check_interval(),
  472:     90 = memsup:get_sysmem_high_watermark(),
  473:     10 = memsup:get_procmem_high_watermark(),
  474:     35 = memsup:get_helper_timeout(),
  475: 
  476:     %% Also try this with bad parameter values, should be ignored
  477:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, memory_check_interval, 0.2),
  478:     ok =
  479:     application:set_env(os_mon, system_memory_high_watermark, -0.9),
  480:     ok =
  481:     application:set_env(os_mon, process_memory_high_watermark,-0.1),
  482:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, memsup_helper_timeout, 0.35),
  483:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, memsup_system_only, arne),
  484: 
  485:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(os_mon_sup, memsup),
  486:     {ok, _Child2} = supervisor:restart_child(os_mon_sup, memsup),
  487: 
  488:     60000 = memsup:get_check_interval(),
  489:     80 = memsup:get_sysmem_high_watermark(),
  490:     5 = memsup:get_procmem_high_watermark(),
  491:     30 = memsup:get_helper_timeout(),
  492: 
  493:     %% Reset configuration parameters
  494:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, memory_check_interval, 1),
  495:     ok =
  496:     application:set_env(os_mon, system_memory_high_watermark, 0.8),
  497:     ok =
  498:     application:set_env(os_mon, process_memory_high_watermark,0.05),
  499:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, memsup_helper_timeout, 30),
  500:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, memsup_system_only, false),
  501: 
  502:     ok.
  503: 
  504: %% Test correct behaviour when service is unavailable
  505: unavailable(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  506: 
  507:     %% Close memsup
  508:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, start_memsup, false),
  509:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(os_mon_sup, memsup),
  510: 
  511:     %% Make sure all API functions return their dummy values
  512:     {0,0,{_Pid,0}} = memsup:get_memory_data(),
  513:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, memsup_system_only, true),
  514:     {0,0,undefined} = memsup:get_memory_data(),
  515:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, memsup_system_only, false),
  516:     [] = memsup:get_system_memory_data(),
  517:     0  = memsup:get_os_wordsize(),
  518:     60000 = memsup:get_check_interval(),
  519:     ok = memsup:set_check_interval(2),
  520:     5 = memsup:get_procmem_high_watermark(),
  521:     ok = memsup:set_procmem_high_watermark(0.10),
  522:     80 = memsup:get_sysmem_high_watermark(),
  523:     ok = memsup:set_sysmem_high_watermark(0.90),
  524:     30 = memsup:get_helper_timeout(),
  525:     ok = memsup:set_helper_timeout(35),
  526: 
  527:     %% Start memsup again,
  528:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, start_memsup, true),
  529:     {ok, _Child} = supervisor:restart_child(os_mon_sup, memsup),
  530: 
  531:     ok.
  532: 
  533: %% Test stability of memsup when data collection times out
  534: timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  535: 
  536:     %% Set a long memory check interval and memsup_helper timeout,
  537:     %% we will force memory checks instead and fake timeouts
  538:     ok = memsup:set_check_interval(60),
  539:     ok = memsup:set_helper_timeout(3600),
  540: 
  541:     %% Provoke a timeout during memory collection
  542:     memsup ! time_to_collect,
  543:     memsup ! reg_collection_timeout,
  544: 
  545:     %% Not much we can check though, except that memsup is still running
  546:     {_,_,_} = memsup:get_memory_data(),
  547: 
  548:     %% Provoke a timeout during extensive memory collection
  549:     %% We fake a gen_server:call/2 to be able to send a timeout message
  550:     %% while the request is being handled
  551: 
  552:     %% Linux should be handled the same way as solaris.
  553: 
  554:     %    TimeoutMsg = case os:type() of
  555:     %		     {unix, sunos} -> ext_collection_timeout;
  556:     %		     {unix, linux} -> reg_collection_timeout
  557:     %		 end,
  558: 
  559:     TimeoutMsg = ext_collection_timeout,
  560: 
  561:     Pid = whereis(memsup),
  562:     Mref = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
  563:     Pid ! {'$gen_call', {self(), Mref}, get_system_memory_data},
  564:     Pid ! TimeoutMsg,
  565:     receive
  566:         {Mref, []} ->
  567:             erlang:demonitor(Mref),
  568:             ok;
  569:         {Mref, Res} ->
  570:             erlang:demonitor(Mref),
  571:             ct:fail({unexpected_result, Res});
  572:         {'DOWN', Mref, _, _, _} ->
  573:             ct:fail(no_result)
  574:     end,
  575: 
  576:     %% Reset memory check interval and memsup_helper timeout
  577:     ok = memsup:set_check_interval(1),
  578:     ok = memsup:set_helper_timeout(30),
  579:     memsup ! time_to_collect,
  580: 
  581:     [_|_] = memsup:get_system_memory_data(),
  582: 
  583:     ok.
  584: 
  585: %% Test that memsup handles a terminating port program
  586: port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  587:     Str = os:cmd("ps -e | grep '[m]emsup'"),
  588:     case io_lib:fread("~s", Str) of
  589:         {ok, [Pid], _Rest} ->
  590: 
  591:             %% Monitor memsup
  592:             MonRef = erlang:monitor(process, memsup),
  593:             {Total1,_Alloc1,_Worst1} = memsup:get_memory_data(),
  594:             true = Total1>0,
  595: 
  596:             %% Kill the port program
  597:             case os:cmd("kill -9 " ++ Pid) of
  598:                 [] ->
  599: 
  600:                     %% memsup should now terminate
  601:                     receive
  602:                         {'DOWN', MonRef, _, _, {port_died, _Reason}} ->
  603:                             ok;
  604:                         {'DOWN', MonRef, _, _, Reason} ->
  605:                             ct:fail({unexpected_exit_reason, Reason})
  606:                     after
  607:                         3000 ->
  608:                             ct:fail(still_alive)
  609:                     end,
  610: 
  611:                     %% Give os_mon_sup time to restart memsup
  612:                     ct:sleep({seconds,3}),
  613:                     {Total2,_Alloc2,_Worst2} =
  614:                     memsup:get_memory_data(),
  615:                     true = Total2>0,
  616: 
  617:                     ok;
  618: 
  619:                 Line ->
  620:                     erlang:demonitor(MonRef),
  621:                     {skip, {not_killed, Line}}
  622:             end;
  623:         _ ->
  624:             {skip, {os_pid_not_found, Str}}
  625:     end.
  626: 
  627: %% Test that alarms are cleared and not set twice
  628: otp_5910(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  629:     Alarms =
  630:     [system_memory_high_watermark, process_memory_high_watermark],
  631: 
  632:     %% Make sure memsup sets both alarms
  633:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, memory_check_interval, 60),
  634:     ok = memsup:set_check_interval(60),
  635:     SysThreshold = (memsup:get_sysmem_high_watermark()/100),
  636:     ProcThreshold = (memsup:get_procmem_high_watermark()/100),
  637: 
  638:     MemData = memsup:get_memory_data(),
  639: 
  640:     io:format("otp_5910: memsup:get_memory_data() = ~p~n", [MemData]),
  641:     {Total, Alloc, {_Pid, _Bytes}} = MemData,
  642:     Pid = spawn_opt(fun() ->
  643:                             receive
  644:                                 die -> ok
  645:                             end
  646:                     end, [{min_heap_size, 1000}]),
  647:     %% Create a process guaranteed to live, be constant and
  648:     %% break memsup process limit
  649:     {memory, Bytes} = erlang:process_info(Pid,memory),
  650:     SysUsage = Alloc/Total,
  651:     ProcUsage = Bytes/Total,
  652: 
  653:     if
  654:         SysUsage>SysThreshold ->
  655:             ok;
  656:         SysUsage=<SysThreshold ->
  657:             ok = application:set_env(os_mon,
  658:                                      sys_mem_high_watermark,
  659:                                      0.5 * SysUsage),
  660:             ok = memsup:set_sysmem_high_watermark(0.5 * SysUsage)
  661:     end,
  662:     if
  663:         ProcUsage>ProcThreshold ->
  664:             ok;
  665:         ProcUsage=<ProcThreshold ->
  666:             ok = application:set_env(os_mon,
  667:                                      proc_mem_high_watermark,
  668:                                      0.5 * ProcUsage),
  669:             ok = memsup:set_procmem_high_watermark(0.5 *ProcUsage)
  670:     end,
  671:     ok = force_collection(),
  672:     ct:sleep({seconds,1}),
  673:     lists:foreach(fun(AlarmId) ->
  674:                           case alarm_set(AlarmId) of
  675:                               {true, _} -> ok;
  676:                               false ->
  677:                                   ct:fail({alarm_not_set, AlarmId})
  678:                           end
  679:                   end,
  680:                   Alarms),
  681: 
  682:     %% Kill guaranteed process...
  683:     Pid ! die,
  684:     %% Kill memsup
  685:     exit(whereis(memsup), faked_memsup_crash),
  686:     %% Wait a little to make sure memsup has been restarted,
  687:     %% then make sure the alarms are set once, but not twice
  688:     ct:sleep({seconds,1}),
  689:     MemUsage = memsup:get_memory_data(),
  690:     SetAlarms = alarm_handler:get_alarms(),
  691:     case lists:foldl(fun(system_memory_high_watermark, {S, P}) ->
  692:                              {S+1, P};
  693:                         (process_memory_high_watermark, {S, P}) ->
  694:                              {S, P+1};
  695:                         (_AlarmId, Acc0) ->
  696:                              Acc0
  697:                      end,
  698:                      {0, 0},
  699:                      SetAlarms) of
  700:         {0, 0} ->
  701:             ok;
  702:         _ ->
  703:             ct:fail({bad_number_of_alarms, SetAlarms, MemUsage})
  704:     end,
  705: 
  706:     %% Stop OS_Mon and make sure all memsup alarms are cleared
  707:     ok = application:stop(os_mon),
  708:     ct:sleep({seconds,1}),
  709:     lists:foreach(fun(AlarmId) ->
  710:                           case alarm_set(AlarmId) of
  711:                               false -> ok;
  712:                               {true, _} ->
  713:                                   ct:fail({alarm_is_set, AlarmId})
  714:                           end
  715:                   end,
  716:                   Alarms),
  717: 
  718:     %% Reset configuration and restart OS_Mon
  719:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon,memory_check_interval,1),
  720:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon,sys_mem_high_watermark,0.8),
  721:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon,proc_mem_high_watermark,0.05),
  722:     ok = application:start(os_mon),
  723:     ok.
  724: 
  725: improved_system_memory_data(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  726:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  727:     ok = rpc:call(Node, application, start, [sasl]),
  728:     ok = rpc:call(Node, application, start, [os_mon]),
  729: 
  730:     ExtMemData = rpc:call(Node, memsup, get_system_memory_data, []),
  731: 
  732:     peer:stop(Peer),
  733: 
  734:     Tags = ?SYSTEM_MEMORY_DATA_TAGS,
  735:     AvailableMemoryPresent
  736:         = lists:foldl(fun ({Tag,Value}, AMP) when is_atom(Tag),
  737:                                                   is_integer(Value),
  738:                                                   Value >= 0 ->
  739:                               true = lists:member(Tag, Tags),
  740:                               case Tag of
  741:                                   available_memory ->
  742:                                       false = AMP,
  743:                                       true;
  744:                                   _ ->
  745:                                       AMP
  746:                               end
  747:                       end,
  748:                       false,
  749:                       ExtMemData),
  750: 
  751:     case os:type() of
  752:         {unix,linux} ->
  753:             {ok, Data} = file:read_file("/proc/meminfo"),
  754:             case re:run(Data, <<"MemAvailable">>) of
  755:                 {match, _} ->
  756:                     true = AvailableMemoryPresent,
  757:                     {comment, "available_memory present in result"};
  758:                 _ ->
  759:                     {comment, "No available_memory present in result"}
  760:             end;
  761:         _ ->
  762:             ok
  763:     end.
  764:                     
  765: 
  766: %%----------------------------------------------------------------------
  767: %% Auxiliary
  768: %%----------------------------------------------------------------------
  769: 
  770: force_collection() ->
  771:     erlang:trace(whereis(memsup), true, ['receive']),
  772:     memsup ! time_to_collect,
  773:     TimerRef = erlang:send_after(5000, self(), timeout),
  774:     force_collection(TimerRef).
  775: 
  776: force_collection(TimerRef) ->
  777:     receive
  778:         {trace, _Pid, 'receive', {collected_sys, _Sys}} ->
  779:             erlang:cancel_timer(TimerRef),
  780:             erlang:trace(whereis(memsup), false, ['receive']),
  781:             flush(),
  782:             ok;
  783:         {trace, _Pid, 'receive', reg_collection_timeout} ->
  784:             erlang:cancel_timer(TimerRef),
  785:             erlang:trace(whereis(memsup), false, ['receive']),
  786:             flush(),
  787:             collection_timeout;
  788:         timeout ->
  789:             erlang:trace(whereis(memsup), false, ['receive']),
  790:             flush(),
  791:             timeout;
  792:         _Msg ->
  793:             force_collection(TimerRef)
  794:     end.
  795: 
  796: flush() ->
  797:     receive
  798:         {trace, _, _, _} ->
  799:             flush();
  800:         timeout ->
  801:             flush()
  802:     after 0 ->
  803:               ok
  804:     end.
